sections.title: Low-Cost Marketing Fundamentals
sections.content: Effective marketing doesn't require a large budget. Focus on understanding your target customers, creating valuable content, and building genuine relationships. The most successful marketing often comes from providing real value rather than traditional advertising.

points.title: Content Marketing
points.description: Create valuable content (blog posts, videos, guides) that attracts and educates potential customers.

points.title: Social Media Marketing
points.description: Build a following on platforms where your customers spend time, focusing on engagement over followers.

points.title: Referral Programs
points.description: Encourage satisfied customers to refer others through incentives and great service.

sections.title: Focus on Your Niche
sections.content: Rather than trying to appeal to everyone, focus on serving a specific niche well. This allows for more targeted, cost-effective marketing.

sections.title: Building Marketing Systems
sections.content: Create repeatable marketing processes that don't rely on constant creativity. Set up automated email sequences, content calendars, and customer feedback systems. Track what works and double down on successful tactics.

sections.title: Implement Budget Marketing
steps: Identify your target customer's preferred communication channels
Create one piece of valuable content (blog post, video, or guide)
Set up profiles on 2-3 relevant social media platforms
Ask satisfied customers for testimonials and referrals

sections.title: Track Everything
sections.content: Even with a small budget, track your marketing efforts. Use free tools like Google Analytics, social media insights, and simple spreadsheets to measure what's working.
